185410835.review:
[h3] Uma experiência inesquecível [/h3]

Friday The 13th: The Game foi, sem dúvida, uma das experiências mais marcantes que tive no mundo dos games. Ele me proporcionou momentos incríveis ao lado dos amigos, seja jogando casualmente ou transmitindo lives para compartilhar a diversão com mais gente.

Era um jogo com um potencial gigantesco, repleto de tensão, estratégia e aquela boa dose de sustos e risadas que só ele conseguia proporcionar. Além disso, a forma como ele capturava a essência dos filmes foi simplesmente sensacional. Os cenários, os sons, as cenas clássicas… dava para sentir o cuidado em tornar a experiência o mais fiel possível, transportando a gente para dentro daquele universo.

É triste ver os servidores sendo desligados, mas as memórias que ele nos deixou continuarão vivas. Para mim (e acredito que para muitos), este jogo será lembrado com carinho como uma obra especial que marcou uma época. Fica aqui minha gratidão aos criadores e à comunidade que fez parte dessa jornada. Obrigado por tudo, Friday The 13th. 💔

[spoiler]Ki ki ki, ma ma ma…
 Ki ki ki, ma ma ma… [/spoiler]

185196213.review:
Friday the 13th: The Game is a thrilling multiplayer experience that immerses players in the chilling world of the iconic horror franchise. Released in 2017 by IllFonic and Gun Media, this game captures the essence of the slasher genre while offering a unique asymmetrical gameplay format that pits one player against several others in a fight for survival.
Gameplay Experience
At its core, Friday the 13th: The Game allows up to eight players to join a session, where one player takes on the role of Jason Voorhees, the relentless killer, while the remaining players become camp counselors trying to escape his clutches. This setup creates an intense atmosphere filled with suspense and excitement.
Jason's Abilities: As Jason, you possess various supernatural abilities like teleportation and enhanced senses, allowing you to track down counselors effectively. Each version of Jason from different films offers unique strengths, adding variety to gameplay.
Counselor Dynamics: The counselors must work together to find items such as car keys, gas, and batteries to escape in vehicles or call for help. The thrill comes from the unpredictability of each match—sometimes you find what you need quickly; other times, it feels like a desperate scavenger hunt.
Immersive Horror Atmosphere
The game does an excellent job of recreating the eerie ambiance of Camp Crystal Lake. The graphics may not be cutting-edge by today's standards, but they effectively convey a sense of dread and tension. The sound design plays a crucial role in heightening the horror experience; the ominous music and Jason's iconic breathing create an unsettling atmosphere that keeps players on edge.
Interactive Environment: Players can hide under beds or inside closets, which adds a layer of strategy to gameplay. The fear of being discovered by Jason while hiding is palpable and mirrors classic horror film tropes.
Community and Multiplayer Fun
One of the standout features of Friday the 13th: The Game is its community aspect. Playing with friends or meeting new players online can lead to memorable moments filled with laughter and tension. The voice chat feature enhances communication among counselors, allowing for strategic planning or frantic calls for help when Jason is near.
Variety in Matches: Each session feels different due to random item placements and player strategies. This variability keeps the game fresh and engaging, as no two matches are ever quite alike.
Challenges and Limitations
Despite its strengths, Friday the 13th: The Game has faced criticism over time. Some players have noted technical issues and bugs that can disrupt gameplay. Additionally, as the game has aged, balancing issues have emerged, particularly concerning Jason's overwhelming power compared to unarmed counselors.
Server Shutdown: As of December 31, 2024, online services for the game have been discontinued due to licensing issues stemming from legal disputes since its release. This has limited access to multiplayer modes but still allows offline play.
Conclusion
Friday the 13th: The Game offers a unique blend of horror and multiplayer gaming that resonates with fans of the franchise. Its engaging mechanics, combined with a strong emphasis on teamwork and strategy, create an unforgettable experience for players. While it may have its flaws, the thrill of surviving against Jason Voorhees is an exhilarating challenge that many will cherish long after their last match. If you're a fan of horror games or just looking for a fun multiplayer experience with friends, this game is definitely worth trying out!

184948126.review:
Friday the 13th: The Game - это игра, которая идеально вписывается в атмосферу культового хоррор-фильма. С момента ее выхода, она привлекла внимание как фанатов сериала, так и любителей многопользовательских экшенов.

Во-первых, стоит отметить многопользовательский аспект игры. Игроки могут выбрать, кем быть — одним из выживших или Джейсоном Вурхизом. Это создает уникальное напряжение и тактический игровой процесс. Играя за выживших, нужно использовать смекалку и командную работу, чтобы избежать столкновения с Джейсоном, у которого есть свои смертоносные способности.

Во-вторых, атмосфера и звуковое оформление игры действительно впечатляют. Звуки шагов, крики, музыка - все это создает ощущение настоящего ужаса и напряжения. Каждый матч ощущается как маленький фильм ужасов, где каждый выбор может стать решающим.

Однако, как и у любой игры, у Friday the 13th есть и свои недостатки. Некоторые игроки отмечали наличие багов и проблемы с балансом в игре, особенно если учитывать способности Джейсона. Это может вывести из равновесия, но разработчики активно работали над патчами, чтобы улучшить игру.

В целом, Friday the 13th: The Game — это отличный выбор для тех, кто ищет острые ощущения и хочет окунуться в атмосферу ужасов. Игра приносит массу удовольствия, особенно в компании друзей, и я определенно рекомендую её тем, кто ценит жанр ужасов и многопользовательские проекты!

184416256.review:
This game's servers have been shot down as of December 31 2024, this game's history is probably more interesting than anything about the game itsef, not cause it was a bad game, not at all, in fact i would be willing to claim this was and will continue to be the best horror franchise adaptation into a videogame ever made. Instead of putting you in a corridor and jump scare you, this game provided this asymetrical arena gameplay where one person got to experience the joy of becoming Jason and the rest of players would have to run, hide, and repair their way out of the most iconic areas from the movies, and it did it perfectly, forget about DBD, never in my life i watched the Friday the 13th movies and thought to myself "this is a universe that would play great as a video game", i actually really struggle to feel like the previous movie in the franchise conects with the next one, cause they just don't, regardles the game's creators harbor such love and pasion for this franchise and found the almost perfect formula to make a game out of this horror fliks. 

Friday the 13th started as a game totally detached from the recognized franchise, called Camp blood the developers wanted to make a game that would homage the Friday movies tone, feel and atmosphere, and by a twist of fate they ended up getting the rights to the franchise and were able to turn this game from a homage to the movies into a real Friday the 13th videogame. It was rought around the edges, full of bugs, and jank, and even worst it was barely possible to find a match during the first days even weaks the game released cause they were not expecting as much people trying to log into their game... The game's popularity blew out of proportion, people wanted to play this game, more than the developers or xbox for example could have realised...

But then of course when something is too good to be true it just won't last forever....
Victor Miller creator of the original Friday the 13th movie and producer Sean Cunningham entered a legal dispute over the rights for the character and franchise wich forced the videogame's development and further updates into a full stop indefinitely causing Gun Media and IllFonic to basically jump the boat and abandon the project to never look back on it and robing of us from the greatest horror game ever made in my opinion.

Now this last paragraph is very personal, i wanted to play it every day till i got my fill, i even dusted off my old xbox machine cause online play on PC was hacked by people forcing players into infinite respawning lobbies and never ending matches where two Jasons kill people over and over again, basically ruining matchmaking for every player out there wishing to joing a public match. So i bought the game again, xbox pass too or whatever its called and jumped into the game this year to celebrate and send off this gem by giving it my proper respects and experience the trill of being hacked to death by a swesty Jason, getting ran over by a trolling Debora, or get left for death by a Chad getting away in a car you put togueter after getting grabed throught the window by Jason, it was gonna be glorious. 
Sadly i have been felling very down this year, even tho i had all the time in the world to play it, i just could not force myself to get up early in the morning, but up the game and look for a match, every night i would go to bed thinking, i didn't feel in the mood today but tomorow i will pay the heck out of this game and have so much fun like i used to.....

Months went by, i did play some days more than others, but i never really stayed on for long, nor i could bring myself to play this game as much as i wanted to, its now January 1st, a couple hours ago i played some matches, i died every time, no bigie, as Jason i did pretty bad too, no problem, i always liked playing the worst Jasons to give councelors a chance anyway, game was always beter when everybody was having fun, i was called for dinner as a match started, i just sat there next to a foldable chair as a leopard Vikini wearing Chad hopping Jason would caught up and smash me againts it...
Came back to check on the game to find that was my last match for the night, sever was down, this game is officially over...

Not gonna lie i feel very sad, alot of people got to play this game till they where tired of it, while i was too tired to play most of the time, we were robed, there was plenty stuff coming our way before they stoped updating it, Jason x, space ship map, Kinky outfits for the whole councelor crew, there was even a snow Jason movie on the works that had to be laid down cause of the Lawsuit, i wish i could have played more, with all of you, rage quiters, sweaty tryhards, clueless casuals, Jason Killers and geometry bug exploiters all the same, it was a great game, i always was having fun no matter what, it was really great you had to be there, it was just so great, the funiest and more enteirtaining game i have ever played despite its flaws, Even staying as an observer just to watch Savini's Jason executions was a blast for me. It was a great time to be alive and play with you all, hope i could have force myself to engage more, but it is what it is, thanks to everyone who was a part of it. 

Go back to mama Jason, you were such a good boy.......

This game holds a pretty special spot in my heart and I hope to see this game brought back someday.

184387007.review:
Having experienced F13's prime over on Xbox, I think this is still the best asymmetrical survival game ever made.

By no means was the game polished, but it was an insanely chaotic and fun labour of love from a team that deeply adored the Friday franchise and the community surrounding it. A community that still keeps this game kicking out of love for what Illfonic crafted, despite being long delisted and (as of today) abandoned and unmaintained.

Here is hoping that Horror Inc. stops C&Ding modded clients beyond this point so the game can live a more fruitful second life in the hands of the people that love it most.

184355782.review:
The story of [i]Friday the 13th: The Game[/i] is a rather sad one and from the perspective of players who are pretty much forced to play [i]Dead by Daylight[/i] instead, to which Friday the 13th - despite its numerous apparent shortcomings - is superior in every aspect.
The reason I mentioned 'from the perspective of players' is because I (/we) can't see behind the curtains, except for the ones involved: the developers and the owner(s) of the copyright to the Friday the 13th franchise. While understandably many people hold the developers accountable - especially how they moved over to a similar [url=store.steampowered.com/app/1433140/The_Texas_Chain_Saw_Massacre/]game[/url] of another famous horror franchise; it is important to note, that shortly after the game was finally released (being in early access for quite a while), just a year later, from June 11, 2018 they were practically not allowed to 'touch' (including releasing new content and fixing bugs) their own game.
Without making accusations - everyone loves money, even though some people MORE so than others - this is mainly due to the doing of the copyright owner, for reasons unknown.

A sad story it is indeed, since this game [strike]has[/strike] had everything (and more) the [url=en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friday_the_13th_(franchise)]Friday the 13th movies[/url] had to offer. Yes, more, because let's be honest here: out of the 12 movies, 9 were utter garbage. Almost everyone knows the original, but while being good and atmosphere-heavy, it isn't really a true Friday the 13th movie: Jason Voorhees makes just a very short appearance and as we all know from the opening scene of the brilliant [url=en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scream_(1996_film)]Scream[/url] - the killer is Jason's mother. There was a remake in 2009 based on the first couple of movies and it wasn't bad either. This leaves us with the [url=en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friday_the_13th_Part_2]2nd part[/url], as the only truly appraisable Friday the 13th movie.
Thankfully, the developers knew this, so the game puts a heavy emphasis on building on the foundations of the 2nd part primarily.

But what [strike]is[/strike] was the game like? We get the basic concept of a multiplayer survival horror game (why do some people call it 'asymmetrical' - are they expecting just killers chasing each other?) in its purest, highly enjoyable form.
There are 7 (+1) counselors (students in their late teens/early 20s, expected to be watching over little kids coming to the camp for summer) who have to survive for 20 minutes while Jason is hunting for them. The map is fairly big and 20 minutes isn't that long, so it doesn't seem to be that hard... or does it?
Well, since Jason cannot be killed, [spoiler]- not entirely true -[/spoiler] can teleport around, hear and occasionally see the counselors from afar and kill basically just by grabbing them, it's by no means an easy task, even if the counselors are able to fight back quite effectively (just like in the movies :)).
The game also offers single player content: lots of trivia can be unlocked and we can relive memorable scenes from the movies.

While the maximum number of counselors in a match is 7, there are a total of 15 of them to choose from. They don't differ just in appearance, each have different statistics making them ideal for various approaches: either running, sneaking/hiding, repairing or fighting back. By equipping 4 perks/skills, we can further increase the effectiveness of the role we decide to play.
Other than these, our best bet is staying together since we can help fellow counselors break free if caught, waiting inside a house (they are well-defendable, since Jason can't enter through windows) or we can call the police, shortening the time we have to endure (we still have to reach the exits where the police car is waiting though). Additionally there are 2 cars and sometimes a boat we can use to escape, but they both need to be repaired and fueled up (it's still not a life insurance, since Jason can easily stop both vehicles).
QTEs - quick time events - (for repairs) work perfectly, without delay.

Jason always starts from the hut and his 4 perks (teleport, heat vision, shifting and stalking) can't be changed. We can however choose from his variations from the different movies along with his preferred weapons and accessories.

steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3396517623

The developers paid attention to small details and there are several seemingly obvious, but great ideas, such as looking for maps which we have to find first in order to avoid running around cluelessly or walkie-talkies that are required for in-game communications (we just hear the screams of nearby counselors otherwise). We also get spooked when being near to Jason, which affects our vision (not only it gets darker, but our HUD also disappears) and our character will become more likely to stumble.
If we get severely injured, our running speed decreases significantly, making our chances for survival almost 0.

Tommy Jarvis (a character who appears in 3 movies) can be summoned by making a call - just like in the case of the police - and with at least 1 counselor already dead (his control will be taken over by the dead player). He has superior stamina and arrives with a shotgun (just a single shot though). Again it's a fun way to draw back a player into the game (instead of just spectating or leaving) and Jarvis is actually useful for a unique move...

Obviously, given the circumstances, the game is littered with all kinds of bugs, some of them affecting gameplay quite seriously. The most annoying one is that Jason can be stunlocked by a well organized group: while practically hard to pull off - too many things have to match, having powerful weapons and no autistic teammates most importantly - it is possible and can result in all 7 counselors surviving. Counselors can also become invincible when hit during certain animations.
Some of the glitches originate from the detailed (not just 1- or 2 layered) relief, certain actions (like the 100+ different, often environmental executions) can only be performed on flat terrain.

The game was amongst the first ones which used Unreal Engine 4 and it still looks great. There are no unnecessary visual effects besides the obligatory mild fog here and there (raining can be turned on optionally for maximum ambiance), just clean, pastel-like colours and along with the locations they provide a realistic look, successfully recreating the visual style of the (first) movies from the 80s. The 5 maps while all look similar (they are centered around Crystal Lake from the first 2 movies) don't get old and are large enough to provide entertainment on the long run.

steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3393684392

The original background theme from the movies is still effective and so is the echoing voice of Pamela Voorhees, which are all present here. The surround sound is amazing, although the minimap (which actually shows Jason's location) lessens its usefulness. The television noise effect when Jason teleports around us is also a nice touch.

Despite the semi-broken state it's in, [i]Friday the 13th: The Game[/i] is still tremendous fun. Now that the game disappears, after its short, 1-year-long glory, I can safely say, it's going to be missed.

PROS
+ very enjoyable gameplay
+ lots of unique ideas
+ large maps
+ great sounds
+ co-operation is rewarding...

CONS
- ...when done right, it can make the game very easy for counselors
- lots of different bugs (no surprise)

RATING
7/10

184264890.review:
This game goes offline tomorrow, by all reports and all accounts, and will be unplayable afterwards. So, this is less of a review and more of a goodbye from me.

Friday the 13th was a love letter to the franchise. It wasn't perfect, but it was far and away the best Jason experience we've ever had with a video game.

It could and should have been so much more, and it's a huge shame that something with so much potential was ruined because two old men couldn't put their egos to the side, and ruined something great for the fans of the franchise.

I had some great times with this game playing with friends, and will always have the memories and clips to remember it by.

It is my hope that someday, somewhere, and somehow, like Jason himself, this franchise returns to the video game medium, and we get a future Friday the 13th game that approaches the standard set by this one. 

Thank you and goodbye, Friday the 13th.

183613221.review: Espectacular juego haciendo referencia a las pelis de los 80 de Jason, donde en una forma aleatoria te puede tocar como él o survivor que son personajes de las mismas películas, parecida mecánica al dbd, diferente que podes escapar de muchas maneras, ya sea por un auto, llamando a la radio, cambiando fusibles, etc... lamentablemente los server este año están por cerrar, pero valió la pena haberlo disfrutado

183611142.review:
This game holds a special place in my heart. I first played it during the COVID-19 lockdown with a group of newfound friends from university, and it became a daily routine to play it every night when everything else was closed down.

The tension of hiding from Jason, the hilarious chaos when plans went wrong, and the adrenaline rush of those last-minute escapes made every match unforgettable. What stood out most, though, was how this game brought us together. It wasn't just about survival. It was about bonding, laughing and all the awesome moments.

Friday the 13th gave me more than just gameplay, it gave me memories I'll cherish forever, farewell old friend <3

183605336.review: EL MEJOR ASIMETRICO DE LA HISTORIA, SE NOS VA UN GRANDE PIPIPI

183603931.review: Friday the 13th: The Game offers a tense and thrilling asymmetrical multiplayer experience, where players either survive as camp counselors or hunt as Jason Voorhees. The creepy atmosphere and strategic gameplay capture the horror essence of the franchise. While there are occasional bugs and matchmaking issues, it’s a great choice for horror fans looking for a multiplayer challenge.
